quote: I'm the girl next door, not the sex symbol.
Being a sex symbol is a heavy load to carry, especially when one is tired, hurt and bewildered.
I am hoping that I can be known as a great writer and actor some day, rather than a sex symbol.

It's not my plan or whatever in my life to be a sex symbol. It never is. You are who you are, but you can't help what you look like. And when you do a film, like for me, it's just not about that. I would prefer to downplay it. I prefer to downplay the sex appeal.
That whole sex symbol thing I never took seriously to begin with. Thank goodness, or I'd be suffering right now because it's out of your hands what happens to you with age.
A sex symbol becomes a thing. I just hate to be a thing.

I'm a hard worker, very driven, and have never expected anything to come easily. My yoga, a great rejuvenator, helped me to live down my image - this sex symbol thing. It helps me connect with myself.

I am not a sexy woman, I'm not beautiful, I'm not a sex kitten, I don't flirt with people, yet I've been tagged more of sex symbol than women who truly are and I that's solely because I don't reveal too much: people are curious.
I'd hate to be a sex symbol. Because you're always having to live up to an image. I haven't got time to sit around doing my nails.
You have to be born a sex symbol. You don't become one. If you're born with it, you'll have it even when you're 100 years old.

I never think of myself as any kind of sex symbol, but I get letters from all over, all sorts. It's really cool. I get a lot from inmates, which is kind of scary. But the best was the guy who wanted to send me a plane ticket to fly me to his prom.
Being a sex symbol is a heavy load to carry, especially when one is tired, hurt and bewildered.
I don't have a problem being labeled a sex symbol, though I personally don't feel very sexy about myself.
I find the whole concept of women screaming at me so odd. It's very flattering, but I don't think I will ever consider myself to be a sex symbol.

I have no illusions at all about being a sex symbol. None of my former girlfriends ever thought of me that way, and I don't have any packs of women chasing me down the street like a Brad Pitt or someone like that.
Being a sex symbol isn't cool unless you're in love with a girl, and she calls you a sex symbol.

If I wake up one day and people tell me I'm not sexy, I'm not going to stop making good music and having fun. That 'sex symbol' thing is typically part of being in the limelight. You better be very talented in your music, but it's good to be nice to look at, I guess.
My fans love me; they've made me this sex symbol. I don't feel I am, but they feel that way. They find me attractive, like I'm a sexy dude. I try my best to make them believe the illusion.

My family was very conservative, and I had a traditional upbringing. I was not brought up to be a sex symbol, nor is it in my nature to be one. The fact that I became one is probably the loveliest, most glamorous and fortunate misunderstanding.
Being a sex symbol was rather like being a convict.
I hate the whole reluctant sex-symbol thing. It's such bull. You see these dudes greased up, in their underwear, talking about how they don't want to be a sex symbol.
I think of myself as an actor first, not a sex symbol. Do I think I'm sexy? No, that's someone else's judgment, and I honestly don't think you can try to be sexy and really succeed.
A sex symbol? A symbol of sex? I don't think that I am a sex symbol, although it's very flattering. I'm 59, now, so I think I'm possibly past my sell-by date. I think I am.

In our society, women are valued for their sexual attraction. I'd like to get away from the sex symbol idea of what beauty is. Actually, that's probably the farthest thing from beauty, because it's makeup and hair, it's pouty lips - it's not real.

God bless America - what other civilization would give Patrick Dempsey another shot to rule as a sex symbol, twenty years after 'Meatballs III: Summer Job?' His reign as Dr. McDreamy on 'Grey's Anatomy' is proof that there's nothing we love more than giving Eighties celebs a heartwarming second stab at life.
For lack of a better term, they've labeled me a sex symbol. It's flattering and it should happen to every bald, overweight guy.
How do I know about a man's needs for a sex symbol? I'm a girl.
I'm not a big fan of trying to be a sex symbol or any of that stuff because I really like the music to speak for itself.

I try to live my life as honestly as I can, and the last thing I want is to pretend to be something I'm not. To pretend to myself I am a sex symbol would somehow be dishonest. I'd feel, in my heart, that I were behaving artificially and that's the last thing I want to do.

I know I have sex appeal, but I've never felt like an actual sex symbol. Fans sometimes think I am. The majority of them are sweet about it, but occasionally somebody weird becomes totally fixated upon me.
Being a sex symbol has to do with an attitude, not looks. Most men think it's looks, most women know otherwise.
I wasn't a sex symbol, I was a sex zombie.
I'm not a sex symbol. How could I be with these skinny bowlegs?
I was in Asia and people asked me about being considered sex symbol. I don't know if that's good or not, because where I come from, sex isn't something you're allowed to talk about.
Mick Jagger, his face was very new. It became a sex symbol.
I would never know how to sell myself as a sex symbol. That's not how I'm programmed.
I know I walk a fine line between being a respected actor and being what they call a sex symbol.
The whole sex symbol or babe thing doesn't bother me.
I think it will be helpful to people because I know the expectations that are put on you as a sex symbol, and how Marilyn Monroe suffered and so on, and I was able to get free of that.
I think any girl who comes to Hollywood with sex symbol or bombshell hanging over her has a rough road.
I am not a sex symbol.
I don't consider myself a sex symbol.
I really enjoy playing a sex symbol, but it's not something I feel in real life. I'm much more of a natural girl at home.
I didn't know I was a sex symbol in the U.K., but if I am, then I'm flattered.
Spock was the sex symbol. A lot of people think it was Kirk. But, no, it was really Spock.
I'm not really the sex symbol type.
I can't be described as a sex symbol; I think it's ridiculous.
I'm passionate about being an actor, but I'm definitely not passionate about being a sex symbol.
I was originally cast to be the brains of the Enterprise. Somehow I became The Chick. There's a little ugly girl inside of me going 'Yay! I'm a sex symbol!'
It's rather amusing at my advanced age to become a sex symbol.
I'm aware that people see me as a sex symbol. But I know I can act.

I have no sense of myself as a sex symbol at all. But the meaning of sex symbol might be a little different in Japan to elsewhere. The Japanese version seems to come with a stronger emphasis on a sort of grownup or mature male charm. And if that's the case, then I guess I'm happy to hear it.
Paul Newman is a sex symbol.
I think Mick Jagger would be astounded and amazed if he realized that to many people he is not a sex symbol, but a mother image.
In terms of men I fancy, I think the actor James Franco is gorgeous. But I find it odd to be described as a sex symbol myself.
I don't know what it means to be a sex symbol. When I look myself on a magazine cover I don't see it as me, but as someone painted, fluffed, puffed and done up.
I don't want to be known as a sex symbol. There's a great stigma that goes with that tag. I want to be a Sam Elliott.
Myra Breckenridge is the antithesis of sex symbol. She's revolutionary; she's a warrior.

People used to come knocking on my door saying, 'Your trouble is that you're a sex symbol who doesn't do enough sexy things.' I'd say to myself, 'You think that if you pressure me I'll fold.' But if I did it, all it would mean is that I sold out.
You can be a sex symbol through music or film. Hey, there are some politicians that are sex symbols. Is that something you should fight? No. Sex is very natural.
I love being regarded as a sex symbol, but I can't take it too seriously.
I still don't buy the idea that I'm a 'sex symbol.'
I wake up every morning, look in the mirror and ask, 'Am I a sex symbol?' Then I go back to bed again. It's stupid to think that way.
If I was a sex symbol, I would be getting laid a lot more than I am now.
I don't think that I am a sex symbol, although it's very flattering.
Maybe one day I'll have a big hit, and the world will make a big sex symbol out of me like they always do when there's a new chick.
I don't think I'll ever be comfortable being considered a sex symbol, especially after you work with someone like George Clooney.
You'd be hard-pressed to find an actor who isn't a sex symbol somewhere.
On 'Being Mary Jane,' I learned to embrace sex symbol.

I realized, 'Oh, it's easier to get what I want if I embrace the sex symbol thing.' Microphones are more in my face, and I can say things about the kids that I mentor and open more access to more doors.
We took Big Pun, a 700-lb Spanish guy, one of the greatest rappers ever, and made him a sex symbol. Women would wait on line to kiss him.
I'm not a sex symbol.
Of course I'm going to be labeled as a sex symbol. I made my bed, and I'm sleeping in it.
When people say, 'You're perceived as a sex symbol,' I love the idea of that because it's so absurd.
Sex appeal is a good thing for commercial cinema. Though I can't sit at home and consider myself a sex symbol, it is for people to do so. I want to be known as an interesting actor.
It's not like I go out there to be a sex symbol. I mean, it's nice of course - but embarrassing.
You watch yourself age and it's hard to feel like a sex symbol.
I was asked to be in Vogue but I said no. I didn't want to advertise make-up. I didn't want to be seen as a sex symbol.
I am not a sex symbol of the Broadway community. I know guys who are, and I say, 'Rock it out.' But I'm more comfortable in a different land. I don't know what land it is, but not that one.
